Title: Information system strategic planning in XYZ foundation at learning and development division
Source title: Proceedings of 2017 International Conference on Information Management and Technology, ICIMTech 2017
Affiliations: Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Hannesto, R., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Surya, M.M., Information Systems Department, School of Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: IS Strategic Planning was conducted based on the framework by Ward & Peppard. Researchers interviewed the management and doing direct observation to determine the current business processes. Background of this study is to achieve the vision and mission of the organization through alignment between IT and business strategy that can brings benefit for organization. The data obtained by distributing questionnaires to the employees of the organization as well as literature. The result of this study is the composition of an application portfolio that contains information system strategic planning needs, management and infrastructure also performance measurement targets indication based on the results of the analysis of the Balanced Scorecard. © 2017 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Business Strategy; Information; Information Technology; Planning; Strategy
Index Keywords: Information systems; Information technology; Information use; Planning; Strategic planning; Surveys; Balanced scorecards; Business Process; Business strategy; Direct observations; Information; Is strategic planning; Performance measurements; Strategy; Information management
